Editing a person

Say, we would like to add a variant name for our Ambrosius Leibn√ºtz entry, and also edit and translate the German content (which was pulled automatically in from GND) into English. From the annotation editor we can use the pencil icon to open the editing form. It will appear in the right hand panel and presents form controls for the information stored in the register. We can edit these fields and just press the save icon when done. At this point new data will be stored in the local register. NB: saving obviously only works for logged in users.

The screenshot below presents a comparison of an entry freshly added to the local register from GND, and the same entry after edits in the TEI Publisher form.

You will note that this form makes use of several types of form controls: basic text fields, for name or date; select for choosing the gender and a custom XML editing widget to edit the note. The latter is a third-party web component called jinn-xml-editor which allows for basic edits and provides syntax checks and higlighting.
